metaDescription: Modern 1-bed, 2-bath apartment in central Torrevieja. 90m² new build with premium amenities. Costa Blanca living at its best.
heroIntro:
Welcome to Parque de las Naciones, Torrevieja's premier residential destination. This stunning 1-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment represents the pinnacle of contemporary coastal living on the Costa Blanca. With 90 square meters of thoughtfully designed space, this new build property exemplifies modern Spanish architecture and quality construction.

Located in the vibrant heart of Torrevieja, this development offers discerning buyers an exceptional opportunity to invest in one of Spain's most dynamic coastal towns. The apartment features clean lines, premium finishes, and intelligent layouts that maximize comfort without unnecessary square footage. The dual bathroom configuration is ideal for couples, investors seeking rental returns, or those who value privacy and convenience.

Torrevieja has transformed dramatically over the past decade, evolving from a quiet fishing village into a cosmopolitan hub that attracts international residents and holidaymakers. This particular property captures the essence of that evolution—blending Spanish charm with European sophistication. Whether you're seeking a Mediterranean base, a rental investment, or a permanent residence, this apartment delivers genuine value in an unbeatable location.
investmentSection:
Torrevieja's rental market remains one of Spain's strongest, with consistent demand from Northern European visitors and mid-term expat rentals. This apartment's central location commands premium rental rates—properties near Parque de las Naciones typically achieve 5-6% annual returns. The dual bathroom configuration particularly appeals to holiday rental operators, who can justify higher weekly rates. Visitor numbers to Torrevieja have grown 18% since 2019, with occupancy rates averaging 65-70% year-round.

Beyond short-term tourism, the town increasingly attracts professionals working remotely, young families relocating from northern Spain, and retirees seeking affordable Mediterranean living. Long-term rental demand has strengthened accordingly. The apartment's modest size makes it an ideal entry point for first-time property investors on the Costa Blanca, with lower acquisition costs and predictable operational expenses.

faqs.question: What are typical rental yields for apartments in central Torrevieja?
faqs.answer: Properties in Parque de las Naciones consistently achieve 5-6% annual returns from holiday rentals and 4-5% from long-term tenancies. Your actual yield depends on management approach, seasonal pricing strategy, and occupancy rates. Professional property management companies in Torrevieja typically charge 20-25% commission but handle guest communication and maintenance.

faqs.question: Is Torrevieja a good place to live permanently or just for holidays?
faqs.answer: Torrevieja is genuinely suitable for permanent residence. The town has excellent healthcare facilities (three major hospitals), supermarkets including El Corte Inglés, international schools, and an established expat community from 80+ countries. The Mediterranean climate, affordable cost of living, and beach lifestyle attract permanent residents of all ages. The key is understanding you're living in a genuine Spanish town rather than a tourist resort.

faqs.question: What are the additional costs beyond the purchase price?
faqs.answer: Budget approximately 10-12% of purchase price for closing costs (notary, property registration, legal fees). Annual community fees typically run €100-150 for a 1-bedroom in this area. Property taxes (IBI) average €400-500 annually. If you plan to rent, professional management costs 20-25% of rental income. Travel insurance and utilities (electricity, water, internet) vary by usage.

faqs.question: How is the neighborhood's safety and community atmosphere?
faqs.answer: Parque de las Naciones is a well-established residential area with active community management. The neighborhood benefits from increased foot traffic due to its central location, which naturally enhances security. The area attracts mixed demographics—young professionals, families, and retirees—creating a balanced community. Property management companies maintain regular presence, and local police patrol frequently.

faqs.question: What makes this apartment better value than similar properties nearby?
faqs.answer: The combination of 2 bathrooms (rare in 1-bedroom units), central location, and new construction standards justifies competitive pricing. Many comparable 1-bed apartments in Torrevieja have only 1 bathroom, limiting their appeal for couples and reducing rental flexibility. The modern build minimizes unexpected maintenance—older renovated properties frequently require costly repairs within 5 years.

faqs.question: Can I use this property part-year and rent it the remainder?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Many owners occupy their apartments 2-4 months yearly and generate rental income the rest of the year. This 'hybrid' approach is popular in Torrevieja and provides an excellent work-life balance. You'll need to establish clear rental management protocols, ensure adequate property maintenance between your stays, and understand Spanish tax implications for mixed-use properties. Professional property managers can coordinate this seamlessly.

locationSection.intro:
Parque de las Naciones sits at the geographical and cultural heart of Torrevieja, placing residents within walking distance of the town's best attractions. The neighborhood has undergone significant regeneration, attracting young professionals, families, and retirees seeking authentic Costa Blanca living. You'll experience a genuine Spanish town atmosphere while enjoying all modern conveniences—supermarkets, restaurants, healthcare facilities, and cultural venues are seamlessly integrated into daily life.

The central location eliminates the need for constant car dependence. Daily errands, entertainment, and dining experiences are accessible on foot or via quick local transport. This walkability is increasingly rare on the Costa Blanca, making this address particularly attractive for those who value convenience and community engagement.
